title: Reject MongoDB in favor of PostgreSQL for backend services
rationale: PostgreSQL provides stronger ACID guarantees, better support for relational data models, and superior performance for our query patterns. MongoDB's document model does not align with our data access patterns and introduces unnecessary complexity for joins.

options_considered.title: PostgreSQL — relational database with strong ACID guarantees
MongoDB — document-oriented NoSQL database
options_considered.rejected_reason: Does not align with relational data access patterns; joins are expensive and complex.

options_considered.title: MySQL — relational database with wide ecosystem support
options_considered.rejected_reason: PostgreSQL offers better support for advanced types, JSON, and full-text search.
